alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 13 at 12:12PM CDT until June 13 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Cottonwood County in southwestern Minnesota... * Until 115 PM CDT. * At 1212 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Even though the rains have ended, runoff from the earlier rains continues to make its way into area streams and rivers. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include the Little Cottonwood River near Jeffers and the Watonwan River around Delft and Mountain Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
